title: Drawing, Architectural Fantasy: Temple of Athena Interior, ca. 1750
title_raw: Architectural Fantasy: Temple of Athena Interior
medium: Pen and black ink, gray wash and white gouache over pencil on laid paper
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Flights of stairs lead downwards to the transept from a hall at left and from the apse at right. The design of the center of the apse has been subjected to a correction. The statue of the goddess was originally intended larger than she was definitely sketched. Only the left side of the the apse shows a colonnade and a relief over it in the rear.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Architectural Fantasy: Temple of Athena Interior, ca. 1750. Pen and black ink, gray wash and white gouache over pencil on laid paper. 
Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-137
